Megan Wolfe Benett and David Martyn Ratzan were married yesterday afternoon at Bourne Farm in West Falmouth, Mass. The ceremony was led by Judith S. Kaye, the chief judge of New York State, who received permission from Massachusetts to officiate.

The bride, 34, is a law clerk to Judge Kaye. In 2001 and 2002 she was a staff lawyer for the Claims Resolution Tribunal in Zurich, which processes claims for dormant Swiss bank accounts from the Nazi era. She graduated from Stanford and received her law degree cum laude from the University of Michigan.

She is the daughter of Edward Benett of Portland, Ore., and the late Gretchen Wolfe. Her father, who retired as a lawyer in Portland, is an owner of the Meridian Estate Vineyard in Silverton, Ore. Her mother was a lawyer at the Illinois Industrial Commission in Chicago. The bride is the stepdaughter of Janice Condit.

The bridegroom, 31, is a candidate for a doctorate in classical studies at Columbia, where he received a master's degree in that subject. Last winter he was an assistant to the director of the excavation of Trimithis, a Roman military camp in southern Egypt. He has two bachelor's degrees, one magna cum laude from Yale and the other from Cambridge University in England.

He is a son of Dr. Susan Ratzan and Dr. Richard M. Ratzan of Avon, Conn. His mother is a professor of pediatrics at the University of Connecticut School of Medicine in Farmington and the head of pediatric endocrinology at the Connecticut Children's Medical Center in Hartford. His father is an emergency physician at Hartford Hospital.
